Job Posting:170256 - Position: F25 Cybersecurity/IT Co-op Student (CIP) 170256 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 06/13/2025 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 06/02/2025 03:42 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country ATCO Group 115 Peacekeepers Drive SW Calgary T3E 7X4 AB Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2025 - Fall F25 Cybersecurity/IT Co-op Student (CIP) 170256 Co-op Position Various Locations, AB Canada 8 or 12 months CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List $24 - $36/hour, dependent upon previous work-term experience September 2025 Cybersecurity/IT Co-op Student (CIP) Job Id: 18515 Apply Before: 06/13/2025 Locations • Calgary, AB, CA Edmonton, AB, CA • What We Offer: • A culture based on caring, integrity, agility, collaboration, safety, and belonging • Salary increases every semester plus 6% vacation pay • Opportunities to give back through ATCO's EPIC Program and team events • Well-Being@ATCO Health & Wellness Program So much more! • Your career journey at ATCO has the potential to be full of new experiences, inspiring challenges, and growth without boundaries. Set your sights on how you want to grow and develop, and we'll be right there to support you along the way. What you get to do: • Partake in the management and development of ATCO's Critical Infrastructure Protection (CIP) Compliance Program and associated processes, procedures, forms, and provide implementation support for changes with employees and contractors. • Contribute to new development, execution, and maintenance of the ATCO Electric ARS compliance process documentation as it relates to AESO ARS CIP Standards. • Regularly review CIP ARS evidence, compliance processes, and associated documentation for completeness. • Review reports (exception, periodic, self-reporting, and self-certification) for completeness and consistency and recommend submission of appropriate reports to the MSA and AESO • Prepare evidence for assigned CIP standards, supporting internal and external audits. • Contribute to and support annual self-certification • Contribute, support, and assist with implementation of compliance software tools • Support regulatory compliance to manage, develop, and maintain effective controls, monitoring solutions, and compliance reports • Partner with other team members in preparing all reporting to both internal and external regulatory agencies • Support senior team members with development and maintenance of department KPI's, assisting with planning improvements, and aligning service improvements with KPI's to foster a culture of ARS CIP compliance Please note that only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Job Requirements Who you are: • Must be enrolled in a co-op (or internship) program at a recognized Canadian university. Have Excellent computer skills and experience working with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing clearly and concisely, using appropriate technical vocabulary. • • Qualifications: • Currently enrolled in a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or related field. • Strong interest and aptitude in cybersecurity and IT. • Proven ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with clients, support staff, vendors, and service providers. • Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot issues in complex mission-critical environments. • Excellent organizational and planning skills with the ability to manage competing priorities. • Strong personal initiative, ability to deliver high-quality results, and a desire for continuous improvement. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Optional Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://careers.atco.com/global/en/job/18515/September-2025-Cybersecurity-IT-Co-op-Student-CIP To apply: • Indicate on your resume how many months you are available for and that you are applying for the September 2025 Co-op Term. Include your most recent transcript in your application. • Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
